title: Drawing, Serving Vessel Design:  Les Sorbets, from the Service des Objets de Dessert [Dessert Service], 1819–20
title_raw: Serving Vessel Design:  Les Sorbets, from the Service des Objets de Dessert [Dessert Service]
medium: Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black and brown wash, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on pink/tan paper, mounted on blue/gray paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown/black ink, on mount, lower right:  Sorbets
provenance:
Collection H.N.
Spencer Samuels, New York
description: Scene in mountains of Central Asia.  A man, left center foreground, shovels ice into a bucket which is suspended from the back of a donkey held by a woman attendant.  Another man in a crouching position, left foreground, gathers a tray of ice with his right hand. Two people lead a donkey down the mountain side, right middleground.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Serving Vessel Design:  Les Sorbets, from the Service des Objets de Dessert [Dessert Service], 1819–20. Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black and brown wash, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on pink/tan paper, mounted on blue/gray paper. 
1989-13-27
